title: Understanding Plantar Warts -- Symptoms
author: WebMD Editorial Contributors

sections.heading: What Are the Symptoms of Plantar Warts?
content: The symptoms of plantar warts include:
bullets: Small, bumpy growths on the soles of the feet, sometimes with tiny black dots on the surface
Pain in the soles of the feet when standing or walking

content_blocks.text: The symptoms of plantar warts include:
associated_bullets: Small, bumpy growths on the soles of the feet, sometimes with tiny black dots on the surface
Pain in the soles of the feet when standing or walking

sections.heading: Call Your Doctor About Plantar Warts If:
bullets: The area becomes red, hot, painful, and tender after treatment; an infection may have set in.
You are unsure whether you have a plantar wart or another condition, such as a corn, callus , mole, or skin lesion. Most such growths are harmless, but some can become problematic.
